thread.title: Super Bowl: Politics front and center at start of game
thread.title_full: Super Bowl: Politics front and center at start of game

author: Gary Klein
title: Super Bowl: Politics front and center at start of game
text:
Live updates from Super Bowl LI: Ready for kickoff Feb. 5, 2017, 3:39 p.m. 
The New England Patriots and the Atlanta Falcons play in the final NFL game of the season today at NRG Stadium in Houston. Follow all the action below. Feb. 5, 2017, 3:39 p.m. Super Bowl: Politics front and center at start of game Gary Klein 
With politics serving as one of the subtexts to the run-up to Super Bowl LI, it was no surprise that the pregame festivities featured some political overtones. 
As they sang “America the Beautiful,” the Schulyer Sisters from the original cast of the smash Broadway musical “Hamilton” -- Phillipa Soo, Renée Elise Goldsberry, and Jasmine Cephas – sang, “And crown thy good with brotherhood – and sisterhood.” 
Former President George H.W. Bush and his wife Barbara received resounding cheers and a standing ovation before they tossed the coin before kickoff. Latest updates
